verses.kjv: What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin, that grace may abound?
verses.ct: So what should we conclude? Should we keep on sinning so that grace will increase?

verses.kjv: God forbid. How shall we, that are dead to sin, live any longer therein?
verses.ct: Absolutely not! Since we have died to sin, how could we possibly keep living in it?

verses.kjv: Know ye not, that so many of us as were baptized into Jesus Christ were baptized into his death?
verses.ct: Don't you realize that all of us who were baptized into Jesus Christ were baptized into his death?

verses.kjv: Therefore we are buried with him by baptism into death: that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father, even so we also should walk in newness of life.
verses.ct: So through baptism we were buried with him into death, so that just as Christ was raised from the dead by the Father's glory, we too would live an entirely new kind of life.

verses.kjv: For if we have been planted together in the likeness of his death, we shall be also in the likeness of his resurrection:
verses.ct: Because if we have been united with him in a death like his, we will certainly also be united with him in a resurrection like his.

verses.kjv: Knowing this, that our old man is crucified with him, that the body of sin might be destroyed, that henceforth we should not serve sin.
verses.ct: We know that our old self was crucified with him so that the power of sin in us would be rendered powerless, and we would no longer be enslaved to sin.

verses.kjv: For he that is dead is freed from sin.
verses.ct: Because anyone who has died has been set free from sin's control.

verses.kjv: Now if we be dead with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him:
verses.ct: Now if we died with Christ, we trust that we will also live with him.

verses.kjv: Knowing that Christ being raised from the dead dieth no more; death hath no more dominion over him.
verses.ct: We know that since Christ was raised from the dead, he will never die again — death no longer has any power over him.

verses.kjv: For in that he died, he died unto sin once: but in that he liveth, he liveth unto God.
verses.ct: When he died, he died to sin once and for all. But the life he now lives, he lives for God.

verses.kjv: Likewise reckon ye also yourselves to be dead indeed unto sin, but alive unto God through Jesus Christ our Lord.
verses.ct: In the same way, consider yourselves dead to sin but alive to God through Jesus Christ our Lord.

verses.kjv: Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body, that ye should obey it in the lusts thereof.
verses.ct: So don't let sin rule over your mortal body, making you give in to its desires.

verses.kjv: Neither yield ye your members as instruments of unrighteousness unto sin: but yield yourselves unto God, as those that are alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness unto God.
verses.ct: Don't offer the parts of your body to sin as tools for wrongdoing. Instead, offer yourselves to God as people who have been brought from death to life, and offer the parts of your body to God as tools for righteousness.

verses.kjv: For sin shall not have dominion over you: for ye are not under the law, but under grace.
verses.ct: Sin will not be your master, because you are not under the law but under grace.

verses.kjv: What then? shall we sin, because we are not under the law, but under grace? God forbid.
verses.ct: So what then? Should we sin because we aren't under the law but under grace? Absolutely not!

verses.kjv: Know ye not, that to whom ye yield yourselves servants to obey, his servants ye are to whom ye obey; whether of sin unto death, or of obedience unto righteousness?
verses.ct: Don't you understand that when you offer yourselves to someone as obedient servants, you become slaves to whoever you obey — whether to sin, which leads to death, or to obedience, which leads to righteousness?

verses.kjv: But God be thanked, that ye were the servants of sin, but ye have obeyed from the heart that form of doctrine which was delivered you.
verses.ct: But thank God that although you used to be slaves to sin, you wholeheartedly embraced the pattern of teaching that was passed on to you.

verses.kjv: Being then made free from sin, ye became the servants of righteousness.
verses.ct: Once you were set free from sin, you became servants of righteousness.

verses.kjv: I speak after the manner of men because of the infirmity of your flesh: for as ye have yielded your members servants to uncleanness and to iniquity unto iniquity; even so now yield your members servants to righteousness unto holiness.
verses.ct: I'm using everyday language because of your human limitations. Just as you once offered the parts of your body as slaves to impurity and to ever-increasing wickedness, now offer them as slaves to righteousness, leading to holiness.

verses.kjv: For when ye were the servants of sin, ye were free from righteousness.
verses.ct: When you were slaves to sin, you had no obligation to righteousness.

verses.kjv: What fruit had ye then in those things whereof ye are now ashamed? for the end of those things is death.
verses.ct: What did you actually gain from the things you're now ashamed of? Those things only lead to death.

verses.kjv: But now being made free from sin, and become servants to God, ye have your fruit unto holiness, and the end everlasting life.
verses.ct: But now that you've been set free from sin and have become servants of God, the benefit you receive leads to holiness, and the final result is eternal life.

verses.kjv: For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
verses.ct: Because the payment that sin gives is death, but God's gift is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
